art_direction: A dark, classical horror aesthetic using monochrome oil painting techniques with unsettling dutch angles to create a sense of unease and decay.

scenes.title: The Threshold
scenes.text: You stand upon the threshold of 'The Gilded Menagerie,' a name that promises splendor but delivers only the scent of stagnant time and forgotten things. Dust motes, ancient and heavy, dance like frantic spirits in the singular, sputtering beam of a bare lightbulb that casts shadows long and predatory. The silence within is a presence, a palpable weight against your ears, broken only by a faint, rhythmic ticking from the sepulchral depths of the shop. Before you lies a labyrinth of silenced lives, each object still containing the ghost of a touch, a gaze, a covetous thought.
scenes.image_prompt: A view from the threshold looking into a cluttered antique shop. A single bare bulb hangs from the center of the ceiling, its light weak and flickering. On the left wall is a tall glass display case filled with porcelain dolls. Deeper in the background on the right, the silhouette of a tall grandfather clock is barely visible. The air is thick with dust. choices.text: Examine the porcelain dolls in the nearby case.
Move deeper, towards the insistent ticking.

scenes.title: Porcelain Touch
scenes.text: A coterie of porcelain children, their faces frozen in expressions of beatific calm, stare out from behind a pane of grimy glass. Their painted lips seem to curl with a secret knowledge as you approach, their silence a condemnation. Compelled by an impulse not entirely your own, you lift a hand to the cool surface of the cabinet, your fingers tracing the outline of a doll's face. A profound, unnatural cold seeps through the glass, a chill that does not belong to this world, sinking deep into the marrow of your bones as you touch the cheek of the nearest figurine.
scenes.image_prompt: A first-person view of a hand reaching out, its index finger touching a small porcelain doll's face through a glass cabinet. The doll has wide, dark glass eyes that seem to stare directly at the viewer. Reflections on the glass are warped and distorted. Pull your hand back, a sudden dread seizing you.

scenes.title: The Ticking Heart
scenes.text: You turn from the silent congregation of dolls, drawn deeper into the shop's gullet by the metronomic beat. It is a great, funereal grandfather clock, its dark wood greedily drinking the meager light. The brass pendulum swings with a hypnotic, inexorable grace, a gilded scythe measuring moments of a life that is no longer present. The shadows it throws writhe upon the walls, elongating and contorting into shapes that defy the logic of light and object, seeming to coil and grasp at the air around you. Beside it, a heavy desk slumps under the weight of ledgers and esoteric junk.
scenes.image_prompt: A very tall, ornate grandfather clock stands against the back wall, its surface dark and polished. Its long brass pendulum is captured in a blur of motion mid-swing. To its left is a cluttered wooden desk covered in books and strange instruments. scenes.title: A Crack in the Mask
scenes.text: You snatch your hand back as if burned, a gasp catching in your throat. The cold remains, a stain upon your skin. You stare at your fingertip under the flickering bulb, and a line of impossible darkness appears. A soundless crack spiders across your nail and onto your skin. Your hand is now porcelain. The sensation is alien; a feeling of profound brittleness settles into your bones, a fragility that promises to shatter. Across the room, you could swear the collected dolls have turned their heads, their painted smiles widening.
scenes.image_prompt: A close-up of a human hand held up to the flickering light from above. A fine, black, spiderweb-like crack runs from the index fingertip, over the nail, and up past the first knuckle. The skin has a faint, unnatural sheen, like glazed ceramic. choices.text: In a panic, smash the display case.
Scrabble for the front door, to flee this place.

scenes.title: The Doll's Gaze
scenes.text: Instead of recoiling, you press your face closer to the glass, peering into the doll's obsidian eyes. They are not mere orbs of painted glass; they are lenses into a place of profound suffering. Within their convex depths, you see a reflection that is not your own—a human face, twisted in a silent, eternal scream, is trapped within. A sympathetic, horrifying petrification begins in your own eyes. They feel heavy in their sockets, the fluid within them thickening, hardening into something cold, solid, and dead.
scenes.image_prompt: A hyper-close-up of a single, black glass doll's eye. A distorted and terrified human face is subtly reflected in its polished, convex surface. The focus is sharp on the reflection. choices.text: Shatter the doll in rage and fear.
Pull away, turning your attention to the desk.

scenes.title: The Gears of Time
scenes.text: With trembling fingers, you unlatch the clock's glass door. The ticking is louder now, a wet and organic sound. As you swing the door open, the sight within defies all mechanical reason. There are no gears, no weights, no cogs. Instead, a delicate cage of polished brass ribs arches in the darkness, and within it, a metallic heart beats in a slow, ponderous rhythm. A single drop of viscous, black oil, smelling metallic and sweet like old blood, falls from the mechanism, a tear from an impossible machine. Your own joints begin to ache, creaking with a dry, clicking protest.
scenes.image_prompt: The open face of the grandfather clock reveals not gears, but a construct of glistening brass pipes and wires that resemble a thoracic cavity. At its center, a complex metal sphere pulses with a faint light. A single drop of dark, thick oil is falling from its lowest point. choices.text: Reach inside to touch the beating heart.
Slam the clock shut and inspect the desk.

scenes.title: The Craftsman's Ledger
scenes.text: You turn to the desk, shoving aside tarnished tools and velvet-lined boxes. Beneath the detritus rests a heavy, leather-bound ledger. You open it, and the spidery script details a blasphemous art: the 'Transubstantiation of the Flesh,' a process for binding human spirit to inanimate matter. It speaks of flesh as a flawed canvas and of achieving immortality through becoming art. The artisan's notes grow more frantic, mentioning a key to the process, a melody he called the 'Lullaby of Silken Gears,' which can perfect the fusion. A faint, tinny music reaches your ears.
scenes.image_prompt: A gnarled, pale hand with unnaturally long fingers rests on an old, open leather-bound book. The book is on a dusty desk, and its pages are filled with spidery script and intricate drawings that fuse human anatomy with mechanical parts. Read on, searching for a way to reverse the process.

scenes.title: The Shattered Chorus
scenes.text: With a guttural cry, you bring your fist down upon the glass. It explodes inward with a sound like fracturing ice. From the broken forms of the dolls, a single, high-pitched shriek escapes—a chorus of trapped voices released at once. The sound pierces your mind, and the transformation accelerates violently. The cracks on your skin deepen, spreading over your entire body. Shards of your own flesh flake away, revealing not blood and bone, but a hollow, ceramic interior. The broken porcelain on the floor glows and writhes, drawn to your shattered form.
scenes.image_prompt: Shards of sharp glass and broken white porcelain lie strewn across a dusty wooden floor. The pieces glow with a faint, malevolent light and seem to be slowly sliding towards a cracked, porcelain-white human hand visible in the foreground. choices.text: Crawl away from the pieces, deeper into the shop.

scenes.title: The Silver Lullaby
scenes.text: The melody, a delicate and deeply unsettling tune, leads you to the back of the shop. There, on a pedestal draped in black velvet, sits a small silver music box, its filigree surface catching the moonlight from a high, grime-caked window. This is the source, the heart of the curse, its lullaby weaving the very fabric of this place into a tapestry of living decay. The tune worms its way into your thoughts, promising a peace that feels like petrification, a stillness that feels like death.
scenes.image_prompt: A small, ornate silver filigree music box sits on a pedestal covered in black velvet. A single shaft of cold moonlight streams down from a high, unseen window, illuminating the box and the dust motes dancing around it. The rest of the room is in deep shadow. scenes.title: The Reversal
scenes.text: Ignoring the siren song, you desperately scan the craftsman's ledger. Your eyes, now clicking faintly as they move, find a passage scrawled in a panicked hand. It speaks of a 'counter-harmony,' a way to sever the soul from the object. But the cost is immense: the ritual requires an untainted vessel and a willing sacrifice of self. You must pour your own memories, your identity, into the object, pushing the curse out by erasing who you are. The clicking in your joints is a constant reminder that your time is running out.
scenes.image_prompt: The craftsman's ledger is open to a page showing a complex diagram of a human silhouette dissolving into a flock of birds. A hand, its skin now partially overlaid with brass clockwork plates and fine wires, hesitates over the page. choices.text: Find an untainted object and attempt the ritual.
It's too much. Surrender to the change.

scenes.title: The Perfected Form
scenes.text: You lift the lid. The music swells, flooding the room with its silken, terrible beauty. Inside, a tiny silver ballerina, her face a perfect, miniature replica of your own, frozen in a silent scream, begins to spin. Your body seizes. An agony that is also an ecstasy rips through you as flesh and bone are unmade and remade. Your skin hardens into lustrous mahogany, your eyes become polished gems, your joints set into articulated brass. You are beautiful. You are eternal. You are a masterpiece. You do not move. You do not think. You simply are.
scenes.image_prompt: The lid of the silver music box is open. A tiny silver ballerina with a horrified face is spinning inside. In the background, a human figure stands in a contorted pose, its limbs twisting and hardening, the skin taking on the polished, dark grain of mahogany wood. scenes.title: The Cacophony
scenes.text: You bring a heavy candlestick down on the silver box. It crumples with a sickening crunch. The music stops. A moment of absolute silence, and then an ungodly, multifaceted scream erupts from every single object in the shop. The curse, its anchor destroyed, lashes out in its death throes. The transformations become uncontrolled, violent. Your body is torn apart. Wood splinters through your flesh, molten brass sears your bones, shards of porcelain embed in your eyes. You are not one thing, but a grotesque, screaming amalgam of everything, an abomination of art that quickly falls silent.
scenes.image_prompt: A chaotic vortex of dark energy and debris in the center of the shop. scenes.title: The Silent Bird
scenes.text: You find it on a low shelf—a small, simple wooden bird, undecorated, unloved, and therefore pure. You clutch it in your hands, closing your eyes. You focus. You push your life into the wood: the face of your mother, your first love, your name, every triumph, every failure. The bird grows warm, then hot, glowing with a soft light. The porcelain brittleness recedes from your skin, the ticking in your joints falls silent. You feel the curse leave you, and with it, everything else. You open your eyes. You do not know who you are, or where you are, but the door is open, and the night air is cool. You are free.

scenes.title: The Collector's New Piece
scenes.text: You crawl on hands that are no longer your own, dragging a body that is becoming a mosaic of shattered ceramics. You collapse in the center of the room. The writhing shards on the floor swarm you, adhering to your skin with a wet, resinous sound. Other objects are drawn to the chaotic gravity of your dying soul. A clock hand impales your shoulder. A swatch of velvet fuses to your cheek. Glass eyes embed themselves in your chest. You are the canvas, and the entire shop is the artist. You become a permanent installation, a silent, watching monument to forgotten things.
scenes.image_prompt: A grotesque sculpture lies in the center of the shop floor. scenes.title: The Heart of the Machine
scenes.text: You reach into the clock's chest. Your fingers brush the beating metal heart. It latches onto you. Brass tendrils, fine as wires, erupt from the mechanism and pierce your flesh, burrowing up your arm with excruciating precision. They follow your veins, they wrap around your bones, they sink into your heart. Sinew is replaced by whirring gears, blood by viscous oil. The ticking of the great clock slows, and for a moment, it stops. Then it begins again, a new, stronger rhythm. Your rhythm. You are the new regulator. You will keep the time here, forever.
